verses.text: Now the Philistines gathered together their armies to battle , and were gathered together at Shochoh , which \add belongeth\add* to Judah , and pitched between Shochoh and Azekah , in Ephes-dammim.\f + \fr 17.1 \ft Ephes-dammim: or, the coast of Dammim, called Pas-dammim\f*
And Saul and the men of Israel were gathered together , and pitched by the valley of Elah , and set the battle in array against the Philistines.\f + \fr 17.2 \ft set…: Heb. ranged the battle\f*
And the Philistines stood on a mountain on the one side, and Israel stood on a mountain on the other side: and \add there was\add* a valley between them. \p
¶ And there went out a champion out of the camp of the Philistines , named Goliath , of Gath , whose height \add was\add* six cubits and a span.

And \add he had\add* an helmet of brass upon his head , and he \add was\add* armed with a coat of mail ; and the weight of the coat \add was\add* five thousand shekels of brass.\f + \fr 17.5 \ft armed: Heb. clothed\f*
And \add he had\add* greaves of brass upon his legs , and a target of brass between his shoulders.\f + \fr 17.6 \ft target: or, gorget\f*
And the staff of his spear \add was\add* like a weaver’s beam ; and his spear’s head \add weighed\add* six hundred shekels of iron : and one bearing a shield went before him.

And he stood and cried unto the armies of Israel , and said unto them, Why are ye come out to set \add your\add* battle in array ? \add am\add* not I a Philistine , and ye servants to Saul ? choose you a man for you, and let him come down to me.
If he be able to fight with me, and to kill me, then will we be your servants : but if I prevail against him, and kill him, then shall ye be our servants , and serve us.
And the Philistine said , I defy the armies of Israel this day ; give me a man , that we may fight together.
When Saul and all Israel heard those words of the Philistine , they were dismayed , and greatly afraid. \p

¶ Now David \add was\add* the son of that Ephrathite of Beth-lehem-judah , whose name \add was\add* Jesse ; and he had eight sons : and the man went among men \add for\add* an old man in the days of Saul.

And the three eldest sons of Jesse went \add and\add* followed Saul to the battle : and the names of his three sons that went to the battle \add were\add* Eliab the firstborn , and next unto him Abinadab , and the third Shammah.
And David \add was\add* the youngest : and the three eldest followed Saul.
But David went and returned from Saul to feed his father’s sheep at Beth-lehem.
And the Philistine drew near morning and evening , and presented himself forty days.
And Jesse said unto David his son , Take now for thy brethren an ephah of this parched \add corn\add*, and these ten loaves , and run to the camp to thy brethren ;

And carry these ten cheeses unto the captain of \add their\add* thousand , and look how thy brethren fare , and take their pledge.\f + \fr 17.18 \ft cheeses: Heb. cheeses of milk\f*\f + \fr 17.18 \ft of…: Heb. of a thousand\f*
Now Saul , and they, and all the men of Israel , \add were\add* in the valley of Elah , fighting with the Philistines. \p

¶ And David rose up early in the morning , and left the sheep with a keeper , and took , and went , as Jesse had commanded him; and he came to the trench , as the host was going forth to the fight , and shouted for the battle.\f + \fr 17.20 \ft trench: or, place of the carriage\f*\f + \fr 17.20 \ft fight: or, battle array, or, place of fight\f*
For Israel and the Philistines had put the battle in array , army against army.

And David left his carriage in the hand of the keeper of the carriage , and ran into the army , and came and saluted his brethren.\f + \fr 17.22 \ft his carriage: Heb. the vessels from upon him\f*\f + \fr 17.22 \ft saluted…: Heb. asked his brethren of peace\f*

And as he talked with them, behold, there came up the champion , the Philistine of Gath , Goliath by name , out of the armies of the Philistines , and spake according to the same words : and David heard \add them\add*.
And all the men of Israel , when they saw the man , fled from him , and were sore afraid.\f + \fr 17.24 \ft from…: Heb. from his face\f*

And the men of Israel said , Have ye seen this man that is come up ? surely to defy Israel is he come up : and it shall be, \add that\add* the man who killeth him, the king will enrich him with great riches , and will give him his daughter , and make his father’s house free in Israel.

And David spake to the men that stood by him, saying , What shall be done to the man that killeth this Philistine , and taketh away the reproach from Israel ? for who \add is\add* this uncircumcised Philistine , that he should defy the armies of the living God ?
And the people answered him after this manner , saying , So shall it be done to the man that killeth him. \p

¶ And Eliab his eldest brother heard when he spake unto the men ; and Eliab’s anger was kindled against David , and he said , Why camest thou down hither? and with whom hast thou left those few sheep in the wilderness ? I know thy pride , and the naughtiness of thine heart ; for thou art come down that thou mightest see the battle.
And David said , What have I now done ? \add Is there\add* not a cause ? \p
¶ And he turned from him toward another , and spake after the same manner : and the people answered him again after the former manner.\f + \fr 17.30 \ft manner: Heb. word\f* \p
And when the words were heard which David spake , they rehearsed \add them\add* before Saul : and he sent for him.\f + \fr 17.31 \ft sent…: Heb. took him\f* \p
¶ And David said to Saul , Let no man’s heart fail because of him; thy servant will go and fight with this Philistine.
And Saul said to David , Thou art not able to go against this Philistine to fight with him: for thou \add art but\add* a youth , and he a man of war from his youth.
And David said unto Saul , Thy servant kept his father’s sheep , and there came a lion , and a bear , and took a lamb out of the flock :\f + \fr 17.34 \ft lamb: or, kid\f*
And I went out after him, and smote him, and delivered \add it\add* out of his mouth : and when he arose against me, I caught \add him\add* by his beard , and smote him, and slew him.
Thy servant slew both the lion and the bear : and this uncircumcised Philistine shall be as one of them, seeing he hath defied the armies of the living God.

David said moreover, The 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* that delivered me out of the paw of the lion , and out of the paw of the bear , he will deliver me out of the hand of this Philistine. And Saul said unto David , Go , and the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* be with thee. \p
¶ And Saul armed David with his armour , and he put an helmet of brass upon his head ; also he armed him with a coat of mail.\f + \fr 17.38 \ft armed David…: Heb. clothed David with his clothes\f*

And David girded his sword upon his armour , and he assayed to go ; for he had not proved \add it\add*. And David said unto Saul , I cannot go with these; for I have not proved \add them\add*. And David put them off him. \p

And he took his staff in his hand , and chose him five smooth stones out of the brook , and put them in a shepherd’s bag which he had, even in a scrip ; and his sling \add was\add* in his hand : and he drew near to the Philistine.\f + \fr 17.40 \ft brook: or, valley\f*\f + \fr 17.40 \ft bag: Heb. vessel\f*
And the Philistine came on and drew near unto David ; and the man that bare the shield \add went\add* before him.
And when the Philistine looked about , and saw David , he disdained him: for he was \add but\add* a youth , and ruddy , and of a fair countenance.
And the Philistine said unto David , \add Am\add* I a dog , that thou comest to me with staves ? And the Philistine cursed David by his gods.
And the Philistine said to David , Come to me, and I will give thy flesh unto the fowls of the air , and to the beasts of the field.

Then said David to the Philistine , Thou comest to me with a sword , and with a spear , and with a shield : but I come to thee in the name of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts , the God of the armies of Israel , whom thou hast defied.

This day will the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* deliver thee into mine hand ; and I will smite thee, and take thine head from thee; and I will give the carcases of the host of the Philistines this day unto the fowls of the air , and to the wild beasts of the earth ; that all the earth may know that there is a God in Israel.\f + \fr 17.46 \ft deliver…: Heb. shut thee up\f*

And all this assembly shall know that the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* saveth not with sword and spear : for the battle \add is\add* the 
d \+w LORD’s|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and he will give you into our hands. \p
And it came to pass, when the Philistine arose , and came and drew nigh to meet David , that David hasted , and ran toward the army to meet the Philistine.

And David put his hand in his bag , and took thence a stone , and slang \add it\add*, and smote the Philistine in his forehead , that the stone sunk into his forehead ; and he fell upon his face to the earth.
So David prevailed over the Philistine with a sling and with a stone , and smote the Philistine , and slew him; but \add there was\add* no sword in the hand of David.

Therefore David ran , and stood upon the Philistine , and took his sword , and drew it out of the sheath thereof, and slew him, and cut off his head therewith. And when the Philistines saw their champion was dead , they fled.

And the men of Israel and of Judah arose , and shouted , and pursued the Philistines , until thou come to the valley , and to the gates of Ekron. And the wounded of the Philistines fell down by the way to Shaaraim , even unto Gath , and unto Ekron.
And the children of Israel returned from chasing after the Philistines , and they spoiled their tents.
And David took the head of the Philistine , and brought it to Jerusalem ; but he put his armour in his tent. \p

¶ And when Saul saw David go forth against the Philistine , he said unto Abner , the captain of the host , Abner , whose son \add is\add* this youth ? And Abner said , \add As\add* thy soul liveth , O king , I cannot tell.
And the king said , Enquire thou whose son the stripling \add is\add*.
And as David returned from the slaughter of the Philistine , Abner took him, and brought him before Saul with the head of the Philistine in his hand.
And Saul said to him, Whose son \add art\add* thou, \add thou\add* young man ? And David answered , I \add am\add* the son of thy servant Jesse the Beth-lehemite.
